snippet.title: Another Qld One Nation candidate dumped
snippet.content: Another One Nation candidate has been axed. This latest causality is Redcliffe candidate John Cox, with his dumping confirmed on Tuesday by Queensland One Nation leader Steve Dickson.Photo: Facebook - John Cox "John Cox is no longer a candidate, but I will not be commenting any further as this is an internal party matter," Mr Dickson said. Mr Dickson would not provide any details regarding the reason for Mr Cox no longer being endorsed as a candidate, but said a replace was being sought. Mr Cox had previously been in hot water after he shared videos suggesting 9/11 was a conspiracy on social media. He joins a long list of One Nation Queensland candidates to quit or be axed by the party since it unveiled its first batch of contenders for the state election in December. Other former candidates include Mark Ellis, who quit in April over , Callide Elise Cottam, who was disendorsed for , and Peter Rogers, who was in January.
